intro: Krynitzkia oxycarya, commonly known as the narrow-leaf krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, which is characterized by succulent leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are small and often clustered, displaying a range of colors from yellow to red. Krynitzkia oxycarya is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
